video.title: Vu du ciel
video.synopsis: Filmed over the course of four years, this environmental documentary series looks at the complex ecological challenges facing the planet.

episodes.synopsis: From microscopic bacteria to the largest animals, this installment explores the incredible biodiversity of the Earth.
episodes.title: Biodiversity: All alive, all connected : part 1

episodes.synopsis: The wondrous journey into the biodiversity of the Earth continues, highlighting the interdependence of the planet's inhabitants.
episodes.title: Biodiversity: All alive, all connected: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Discover why fresh water is the most precious resource on Earth, vital to life and prosperity, but is also one of the most threatened.
episodes.title: Fresh Water: The Blue Gold: part 1

episodes.synopsis: The investigation into the importance of water continues with spectacular scenery of canyons, glaciers and waterfalls, as well as man-made structures.
episodes.title: Fresh Water: The Blue Gold: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Covering 72 percent of the planet, the sea is an extensive, but not inexhaustible, resource. This episode sheds light on how to protect it.
episodes.title: Sea and Oceans: “Deep Blue: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Through stunning photography of locations around the globe, host Yann Arthus-Bertrand further explores humankind's interdependence with the sea.
episodes.title: Sea and Oceans: “Deep Blue: part 2

episodes.synopsis: As man's impact on Earth reaches an all-time high, meet innovators who are attempting to reverse the damage and write a new contract with nature.
episodes.title: The Earth and its Resources: “Save the earth”: part 1

episodes.synopsis: In scenes across the globe from America to China, this exploration of man's influence on the Earth also includes discussion on how to lighten it.
episodes.title: The Earth and its Resources: “Save the earth”: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Meet farmers who are fighting against the excesses of modern and intensive agriculture, including pesticides and genetically modified organisms.
episodes.title: Six Billion Men to Feed : part 1

episodes.synopsis: To foster sustainable development, consumers can influence agricultural practices by changing their eating habits.
episodes.title: Six Billion Men to Feed : part 2

episodes.synopsis: Visit South Africa, an exemplary country for the protection of biodiversity, where cohabitation with the wild introduces a new humanistic philosophy.
episodes.title: Men and Animals: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Yann Arthus-Bertrand meets individuals who have taken on the protection of wild animals such as the elephant, the seal and the white rhino.
episodes.title: Men and Animals: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Many of the world's waterways are dried up or polluted. In Argentina, a dam at Iguazu Falls affects the local population and environment.
episodes.title: The Great Rivers: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Yann Arthus-Bertrand visits China and its disproportionate Three Gorges dam, as well as the Botswana Okavango, the Aral Sea and New York.
episodes.title: The Great Rivers: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Madagascar has experienced extreme deforestation. Botanists are attempting to protect the native baobab trees and other island fauna.
episodes.title: The Forest: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Vegetation is crucial to sustaining life. Host Yann Arthus-Bertrand meets those who have committed their lives to protecting the world's forests.
episodes.title: The Forest: part 2

episodes.synopsis: In this installment, the team looks at ways to achieve equilibrium between sustainable development and the growth needed to support 7 billion people.
episodes.title: Gabon: Plan B: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Yann Arthus-Bertrand talks to a resolute group of people who are changing human behavior to preserve the planet's natural resources.
episodes.title: Gabon: Plan B: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Traveling to Japan, Yann Arthus-Bertrand addresses waste and the overconsumption of food, electronics and other products by wealthy countries.
episodes.title: Japan: Consumption, Our Imprint on the Environment: part 1

episodes.synopsis: The repercussions of excessive consumption are examined, including its significant -- and perhaps irreversible -- harm to the environment.
episodes.title: Japan: Consumption, Our Imprint on the Environment: part 2

episodes.synopsis: With the world's energy supplies dwindling, host Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team head to the most oil-dependent country on Earth: the United States.
episodes.title: The End of Oil: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Host Yann Arthus-Bertrand looks at life without oil and the production of alternative energy resources for the future.
episodes.title: The End of Oil: part 2

episodes.synopsis: This edition explores a variety of threats to the planet, including melting glaciers, rising sea levels and carbon emissions.
episodes.title: Climate Disorder – Special: “One night for the Earth”

episodes.synopsis: Focusing on Bangladesh, this edition looks at people who left their lives behind to work with charities and bring meaningful change to those in need.
episodes.title: Heroes of nature: Bangladesh : part 1

episodes.synopsis: Through their foundation, Yves and Runa Marre are providing health care to isolated communities in Bangladesh aboard a floating hospital.
episodes.title: Heroes of nature: Bangladesh: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Host Yann Arthus-Bertrand speaks to Prince Charles about forest preservation efforts, and to Temple Grandin, an innovator in the livestock industry.
episodes.title: The Hand of Man: Canada: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Examine environmental problems brought on by Quebec's hydroelectric dams, and meet an architect whose structures are made of reclaimed materials.
episodes.title: The Hand of Man: Canada: Part 2

episodes.synopsis: Yann Arthus-Bertrand travels through Senegal to meet men and women who have dedicated their lives to preserving the environment.
episodes.title: The Natural Reserves: Senegal: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Host Yann Arthus-Bertrand speaks with people who are dedicating their lives to preserving the environment and aiding Senegal's citizens.
episodes.title: The Natural Reserves: Senegal: part 2

episodes.synopsis: Study the rebirth of nature that followed the 1980 eruption of Mount St. Helens, and visit Indonesia to witness the world's most sulfuric volcano.
episodes.title: Heroes of nature: Volcanoes: part 1

episodes.synopsis: Yann Arthus-Bertrand travels to Italy, home to the largest number of active volcanoes in Europe, to discuss the possible results of an eruption.
episodes.title: Heroes of nature: Volcanoes: : part 2
